text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to note that the court can refuse to act if it does not consider it appropriate to do so because the seat of arbitration is outside England & Wales. The candidate answer addresses this under 'Seat of arbitration considerations' by stating: 'Section 2(3) of the Arbitration Act 1996 extends certain court powers (including s.44) to arbitrations seated outside England, but the court retains a **discretion** about whether to exercise those powers. The court will consider: ... Whether it is appropriate for the English court to act given the foreign seat'. This explicitly covers the concept that the foreign seat influences the court's discretion to refuse to act if deemed inappropriate.", "criterion_id": "f319b040-3157-48dd-bb9f-24ca01953844"}
